metadata.title: CVE-2022-42719 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free in the mac80211 stack when parsing a multi-BSSID elementin the Linux kernel 5.2 through 5.19.x before 5.19.16 could be used byattackers (able to inject WLAN frames) to crash the kernel and potentiallyexecute code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-42719` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.19.0-23.24
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-23.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.19.0-23.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic-64k - 5.19.0-23.24
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-azure - 5.19.0-1010.11
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-gcp - 6.2.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1001-ibm - 6.2.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1003.3
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-oracle - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi - 6.2.0-1004.5
linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 6.2.0-1004.5
No subscription required

linux-aws package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1003.3').

backport-iwlwifi-dkms package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
